work up.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to make yourself feel interested, brave etc
work up.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: I’m trying to work up enough courage to go to the dentist.
work up.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to make yourself hungry or thirsty, or make yourself sweat, especially by doing physical exercise
work up.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: You can work up a really big thirst playing tennis.
work up.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to make someone very angry, excited, or upset about something
work up.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: She had worked herself up into a state.
work up.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to develop and improve something such as a project or a piece of writing
work up.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Jack took notes which he would work up into a report later.
